docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (CBS) SURVIVOR: ONE WORLD The old saying ''no pain, no gain'' will be tested this week as the competition for $1 million continues. (Above, Greg Smith, left, and Jay Byars during an immunity challenge.) With both tribes living on the same site, drama runs high as the tribal council makes an unexpected decision. 1:30 P.M. (Sundance) GRIZZLY MAN (2005) Timothy Treadwell, who spent many of his summers living with and filming grizzly bears in the Katmai National Park and Preserve in Alaska, below, was killed in a bear attack in 2003, along with his girlfriend, Amie Huguenard. The director Werner Herzog combed through their footage to create this documentary, which casts an unsentimental eye on Treadwell's mission to protect the grizzlies and questions his preparation for life in the wilderness. Interviews with family members and friends shed light on Treadwell's past as an actor who struggled with addiction. And those who last saw him, including the medical examiner who performed his autopsy, depict him as a man who failed to appreciate the power and danger of nature. Writing in The New York Times, Manohla Dargis said that Treadwell's adventures with grizzlies amounted to ''a kind of performance, built on lies and truth and played out on the stage of celebrity.'' She added, ''Even though his choices were dangerous and finally fatal, he traveled a familiar American path shaped by boundless optimism and an almost religious belief in the self.''
